verses.verse: Do not sharply <S%G1969><s%> rebuke <S%G1969><s%> an older <S%G4245><s%> man, <S%G4245><s%> but [rather] appeal <S%G3870><s%> to [him] as a father, <S%G3962><s%> [to] the younger <S%G3501><s%> men <S%G3501><s%> as brothers, <S%G80><s%>
the older <S%G4245><s%> women <S%G4245><s%> as mothers, <S%G3384><s%> [and] the younger <S%G3501><s%> women <S%G3501><s%> as sisters, <S%G79><s%> in all <S%G3956><s%> purity. <S%G47><s%>
Honor <S%G5091><s%> widows <S%G5503><s%> who are widows <S%G5503><s%> indeed; <S%G3689><s%>

but if <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> widow <S%G5503><s%> has <S%G2192><s%> children <S%G5043><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> grandchildren, <S%G1549><s%> let them first <S%G4413><s%> learn <S%G3129><s%> to practice <S%G2151><s%> piety <S%G2151><s%> in regard to their own <S%G2398><s%> family, <S%G3624><s%> and to make <S%G591><s%> some return <S%G591><s%> to their parents; <S%G4269><s%> for this <S%G3778><s%> is acceptable <S%G587><s%> in the sight <S%G1799><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> she who is a widow <S%G5503><s%> indeed, <S%G3689><s%> and who has been left <S%G3443><s%> alone <S%G3443><s%> has fixed <S%G1679><s%> her hope <S%G1679><s%> on God, <S%G2316><s%> and continues <S%G4357><s%> in entreaties <S%G1162><s%> and prayers <S%G4335><s%> night <S%G3571><s%> and day. <S%G2250><s%>
But she who gives <S%G4684><s%> herself <S%G4684><s%> to wanton <S%G4684><s%> pleasure <S%G4684><s%> is dead <S%G2348><s%> even while she lives. <S%G2198><s%>
Prescribe <S%G3853><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things <S%G3778><s%> as well, <S%G2532><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that they may be above <S%G423><s%> reproach. <S%G423><s%>

But if <S%G1487><s%> anyone <S%G5100><s%> does not provide <S%G4306><s%> for his own, <S%G2398><s%> and especially <S%G3122><s%> for those of his household, <S%G3609><s%> he has denied <S%G720><s%> the faith, <S%G4102><s%> and is worse <S%G5501><s%> than an unbeliever. <S%G571><s%>

Let a widow <S%G5503><s%> be put <S%G2639><s%> on the list <S%G2639><s%> only if she is not less <S%G1640><s%> than sixty <S%G1835><s%> years <S%G2094><s%> old, [having been] the wife <S%G1135><s%> of one <S%G1520><s%> man, <S%G435><s%>

having <S%G3140><s%> a reputation <S%G3140><s%> for good <S%G2570><s%> works; <S%G2041><s%> [and] if <S%G1487><s%> she has brought <S%G5044><s%> up children, <S%G5044><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> she has shown <S%G3580><s%> hospitality <S%G3580><s%> to strangers, <S%G3580><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> she has washed <S%G3538><s%> the saints' feet, <S%G4228><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> she has assisted <S%G1884><s%> those in distress, <S%G2346><s%> [and] if <S%G1487><s%> she has devoted <S%G1872><s%> herself <S%G1872><s%> to every <S%G3956><s%> good <S%G18><s%> work. <S%G2041><s%>

But refuse <S%G3868><s%> [to put] younger <S%G3501><s%> widows <S%G5503><s%> [on the list], for when <S%G3752><s%> they feel <S%G2691><s%> sensual <S%G2691><s%> desires <S%G2691><s%> in disregard <S%G2691><s%> of Christ, <S%G5547><s%> they want <S%G2309><s%> to get <S%G1060><s%> married, <S%G1060><s%>
[thus] incurring <S%G2192><s%> condemnation, <S%G2917><s%> because <S%G3754><s%> they have set <S%G114><s%> aside <S%G114><s%> their previous <S%G4413><s%> pledge. <S%G4102><s%>

And at the same <S%G260><s%> time <S%G260><s%> they also <S%G2532><s%> learn <S%G3129><s%> [to be] idle, <S%G692><s%> as they go <S%G4022><s%> around <S%G4022><s%> from house <S%G3614><s%> to house; <S%G3614><s%> and not merely <S%G3441><s%> idle, <S%G692><s%> but also <S%G2532><s%> gossips <S%G5397><s%> and busybodies, <S%G4021><s%> talking <S%G2980><s%> about things <S%G7506><s%> not proper <S%G7506><s%> [to mention.]

Therefore, <S%G3767><s%> I want <S%G1014><s%> younger <S%G3501><s%> [widows] to get <S%G1060><s%> married, <S%G1060><s%> bear <S%G5041><s%> children, <S%G5041><s%> keep <S%G3616><s%> house, <S%G3616><s%> [and] give <S%G1325><s%> the enemy <S%G480><s%> no <S%G3367><s%> occasion <S%G874><s%> for reproach; <S%G3059><s%>
for some <S%G5100><s%> have already <S%G2235><s%> turned <S%G1624><s%> aside <S%G1624><s%> to follow <S%G3694><s%> Satan. <S%G4567><s%>

If <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> woman <S%G5100><s%> who is a believer <S%G4103><s%> has <S%G2192><s%> [dependent] widows, <S%G5503><s%> let her assist <S%G1884><s%> them, and let not the church <S%G1577><s%> be burdened, <S%G916><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that it may assist <S%G1884><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> who are widows <S%G5503><s%> indeed. <S%G3689><s%>

Let the elders <S%G4245><s%> who rule <S%G4291><s%> well <S%G2573><s%> be considered <S%G515><s%> worthy <S%G515><s%> of double <S%G1362><s%> honor, <S%G5092><s%> especially <S%G3122><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> who work <S%G2872><s%> hard <S%G2872><s%> at preaching <S%G3056><s%> and teaching. <S%G1319><s%>

For the Scripture <S%G1124><s%> says, <S%G3004><s%> "You shall not muzzle <S%G5392><s%> the ox <S%G1016><s%> while he is threshing, <S%G248><s%>" and "The laborer <S%G2040><s%> is worthy <S%G514><s%> of his wages. <S%G3408><s%>"

Do not receive <S%G3858><s%> an accusation <S%G2724><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> an elder <S%G4245><s%> except <S%G1622><s%> <S%G1508><s%> on the basis <S%G1909><s%> of two <S%G1417><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> three <S%G5140><s%> witnesses. <S%G3144><s%>

Those <S%G3588><s%> who continue in sin, <S%G264><s%> rebuke <S%G1651><s%> in the presence <S%G1799><s%> of all, <S%G3956><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that the rest <S%G3062><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> may be fearful <S%G5401><s%> [of sinning.]

I solemnly <S%G1263><s%> charge <S%G1263><s%> you in the presence <S%G1799><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> and of Christ <S%G5547><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> and of [His] chosen <S%G1588><s%> angels, <S%G32><s%> to maintain <S%G5442><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> [principles] without <S%G5565><s%> bias, <S%G4299><s%> doing <S%G4160><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> in a [spirit of] partiality. <S%G4346><s%>

Do not lay <S%G2007><s%> hands <S%G5495><s%> upon anyone <S%G3367><s%> [too] hastily <S%G5030><s%> and thus <S%G3366><s%> share <S%G2841><s%> [responsibility for] the sins <S%G266><s%> of others; <S%G245><s%> keep <S%G5083><s%> yourself <S%G4572><s%> free <S%G53><s%> from sin. <S%G53><s%>

No <S%G3371><s%> longer <S%G3371><s%> drink <S%G5202><s%> water <S%G5202><s%> [exclusively,] but use <S%G5530><s%> a little <S%G3641><s%> wine <S%G3631><s%> for the sake <S%G1223><s%> of your stomach <S%G4751><s%> and your frequent <S%G4437><s%> ailments. <S%G769><s%>

The sins <S%G266><s%> of some <S%G5100><s%> men <S%G444><s%> are quite <S%G4271><s%> evident, <S%G4271><s%> going <S%G4254><s%> before <S%G4254><s%> them to judgment; <S%G2920><s%> for others, <S%G5100><s%> their [sins] follow <S%G1872><s%> after. <S%G1872><s%>

Likewise <S%G5615><s%> also, <S%G2532><s%> deeds <S%G2041><s%> that are good <S%G2570><s%> are quite <S%G4271><s%> evident, <S%G4271><s%> and those <S%G3588><s%> which are otherwise <S%G247><s%> cannot <S%G1410><s%> <S%G3756><s%> be concealed. <S%G2928><s%>
